channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Report 1 of 3: 'Venue' housing developer direction sign on lamp column by 47, Lawrie Park Road, Sydenham, LB Bromley., 12th October
item.description:
Report 1 of 3: 'Venue' housing developer direction sign on lamp column by 47, Lawrie Park Road, Sydenham, LB Bromley. This sign (and the flats development in William Booth Rd, Anerley) has been there about 15 years. Please remove it and the other two I am reporting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51-59, Lawrie Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow plastic barriers and a single small sand bag with no action taken for months, on the footway in Beckenham Rd, Beckenham about 8m E of the jct with Churchfields Rd, 12th October
item.description:
Yellow plastic barriers and a single small sand bag with no action taken for months, on the footway in Beckenham Rd, Beckenham about 8m E of the jct with Churchfields Rd - also a shared use cycle path. These have been there for around 6 months, no work is taking place and it is an obstruction and eyesore. Someone else reported this as FMS reference number https://fix.bromley.gov.uk/report/8009028 on 11 August 2025 after months of inaction. It is now 12th October 2025. Please secure the repair and recharge the utility company if they are inactive and incompetent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80-98, Beckenham Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Man & dog living in dumped van, 12th October
item.description:
A van appeared in our road about 2 weeks ago, it has become obvious that there is a man and a dog living in it, I'm not sure if it is his vehicle or if it was dumped and he has now moved into it. Today he was outside the van with the side loading door open talking to himself and gesticulating whilst the dog was tied to a lamp post. My grandhildren were scared of the guy, who looks dishevelled, he didnt approach them, but there is a primary school opposite where is parked and could be worrying for children on there way to school if he is hanging around the van.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Parkwood Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Forest bike on electric vehicles charging space, 12th October
item.description:
A Forest bike has been left in the parking space by the electric vehicle charger outside 83 Leander Road, which is clearly marked as reserved for electric vehicles only. Electric vehicles cannot use the charging spot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leander Road, Brixton, London

item.title: Dumped sofa and rubbish for months, 12th October
item.description:
These dirty old sofas and furniture has been dumped outside 40 Elliscombe Road for months now. It stinks, is a health hazard and obscures the pavement making it impossible for people in wheelchairs or with pushchairs to pass safely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elliscombe Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Abandoned Butane Gas Bottles and Large Household Waste, 12th October
item.description:
Several butane gas bottles and large household items have been illegally dumped on the street. These items present both safety and environmental hazards and obstruct the public pathway. The butane bottles are highly flammable and pose a risk of explosion if exposed to heat or tampered with.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
